LineComment.Text: ### 1] Check if the ID of this EM fits inside the EM Index table
Open data block as shared data block
Load length of shared data block (length of DB)
Error and end the block if id bigger than length of the DB
if id is bigger than length end the block
### 2] Write this DB number to the EM Index table
find the number of the current fb
find the db number of current fb
prepare the pointer for the location in the EM Index DB

AttributeList.Text: The EM will publish its DB number to the EM Index table
Publish DB number to EM Index
Copy all Setpoints from the UDT

If the previous Command is not the same as the current one then reset the timers, else increase them This is at the start of the FB because normal commandchanges will take till the next cycle to become active
create a pulse active on the first cycle of a new scan this signal can be used in the state to execute some actions in the first cycle of the state
Collect the errors from the CMs

This code tries to assign an error message to each CM error If multiple CMs have an error then it only stores one This is the EM type so we don't know which CM instance is connected So the error only contains the general name of the CM instance If the actual name needs to be shown then it could be deducted at a higher level using the CM name and EM instance network_end.render(lib, "ssign a message number to each error") }}
Assign a message number to each error

LineComment.Text: skip this network if stepnumber not equal to 0
make sure RLO is high so the state can happen when no conditions present
End of network: jump here if step not active
Jump to end of this FB if the step has been active to avoid
execution of another step in the same scan

AttributeList.Text: Copy all Process Values to the UDT
Phases don't clean up their requests on the EM side So at the end of the EM reset the request If the phase is still there then it will write the request again by the next scan
